body.name: Science Comics: Electricity: Energy in Action
body.merchantInfo: Sold by tLighthouse Books and Fulfilled by Amazon.
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review A Junior Library Guild selection About the Author Andy Hirsch is a cartoonist living in Dallas, Texas. He is the author and illustrator of several entries in First Second's Science Comics series, including Dogs: From Predator to Protector, Trees: Kings of the Forest, and Cats: Nature and Nurture.

body.description: Get a charge out of Electricity, a new edition to the Science Comics series!Giant monsters are on the warpath, and it’s Menlo the mech’s job to protect the city! But when this metal marvel is shut down by an unlucky lightning strike, a resourceful engineer and his high-energy niece will have to find a way to plug in and power up to save everyone from certain doom!From simple circuits to giant grids, fossil fuel power plants to wind farms, electricity keeps the world running. In Science Comics: Electricity, you’ll discover where electricity comes from, why lightning suddenly strikes, and how we’ve harnessed it all to turn the lights on in your room. Ready for action? Get energized with electricity! Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This book is no joke!
reviews.reviewText: We love this series and with my 5-going-on-12 year old’s new found love of building circuits, I thought this would help with some of the fundamental concepts. Whew - it is dense, full of lots of information, so much so that you really do have to spend time discussing the concepts and not just reading it straight through. My little loves it though and has asked to read more of it each of the past three nights. I am pretty sure this is going to stay in his top science books rotation. We have lots of favorites from the same series that he comes back to over and over - Plagues, Cars, the Brain, Volcanoes, Trees, the Solar System, Rocks & Minerals, Bats, Wild Weather, and Digestion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My 11 year old son said that it is kind of complicated but he is able to understand most of it. He will read this over and over until he he can grasp it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love this series -
reviews.reviewText: Most importantly, my kids love the series as well, and this book is as good as all of them. They often share random facts and quote learning from these comics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another Quality Science Comics That Fun For Kids!
reviews.reviewText: My 6 and 8 yos love this book! There are parts of it where they laugh out loud. It's wonderful that they are having fun reading it while learning about electricity too!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I purchase books for my grandchildren leading up to Christmas. They enjoyed this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing science books
reviews.reviewText: It makes science so much fun and easy to understand for kids.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not even the science comics series can make electricity fun and simple
reviews.reviewText: My sons love this series and we own almost the entire thing. They were so excited that electricity was coming up and we preordered it on the spot. But for the first time with this series I’m a bit disappointed. They are very scienc-y kids but they were kind of bored, and a lot of concepts went over their heads. The pace is half-hazard and the art is a bit confusing. The science doesn’t tie into the story as well as the other books. I still love the series and will continue collecting all the books, but this one was the first one in the series that I felt like “meh”

reviews.reviewTitle: If you’re looking for something special in a comic
reviews.reviewText: Have been buying these comics for my two grandsons for a couple of years.They love the comic format and stories and learn a great deal about each subject from these.
